sn56.62:1.1: Then the Buddha, picking up a little bit of dirt under his fingernail, addressed the mendicants:
sn56.62:1.3: Which is more: the little bit of dirt under my fingernail, or this great earth?”
sn56.62:1.4: “Sir, the great earth is certainly more. The little bit of dirt under your fingernail is tiny.
sn56.62:1.5: Compared to the great earth, it doesn’t count, there’s no comparison, it’s not worth a fraction.”
sn56.62:2.1: “In the same way, the sentient beings reborn in central countries are few, while those reborn in the borderlands, among strange barbarian tribes, are many. …”
